Materials

All materials used in this course will be online and freely available for re-use. We will also continue to provide the links for past materials.

Topics are focused on the analysis of microbial metagenomic data including amplicon, shotgun metagenomics and the skills needed to use these tools, such as the command line and cloud computing. A more detailed overview is below.

We hope these materials can be helpful if youâ€™re teaching these topics yourself, or to use them for self-guided learning. If you do find them helpful, please let us know

Materials

2015 Tutorials

Overview of 2015 materials

Tutorials Organized by Learning Goals

  • Computing literacy
    • Shell
    • tmux for remote sessions
    • Getting started with GitHub
  • Cloud computing
    • Amazon EC2 start-up
    • File transfer to the EC2
  • Microbial amplicon analysis
    • Assessing sequencing quality
    • Subsampling a large amplicon dataset for developing an analysis workflow
    • Paired end merging (with PANDASeq)
    • QIIME workflow: rarefaction, building an OTU table, diversity analysis
      1. Part 1: Building an OTU Table
      2. Part 2: Within-Sample Diversity and visualizations
      3. Part 3: Comparative Diversity and OTU table export
    • mothur workflow
  • Microbial shotgun metagenome analysis
    • Installing mg tools on the EC2
    • Demo: using seqtk for subsampling a large metagenome dataset for developing an analysis workflow
    • Quality Trimming
    • Digital normalization
    • Assembly with MEGAHit
    • Annotation of assembled reads
    • Xander for targeted gene assembly
  • Ecological Statistics with R
    • R basics
    • Visualizations Demo
  • Using Databases
    • Local BLAST
    • Using APIs to access NCBI and MG-RAST data
